section.title: Uses of like
section.sectiontitle: Use what + to be + subject + like? to ask for a general description. Do not use like in the answer.
section.text1a: It's a fantastic city full of culture and pretty streets.
section.text2a: He was a wonderful man, very funny and interesting.
section.sectiontitle2: Use what does/do + subject + look like to talk about physical appearance. Do not use like in the answer.
section.text3: What does the library look like?
section.text3a: It is a tall building with grey brick and lots of windows.
section.text4: Do you look like your sister?
section.text4a: Yes, we both have long brown hair and green eyes.

section.title: Uses of like
section.sectiontitle: Also use like to talk about something being similar to another thing (or acting in the same way).
section.text2a: He is behaving like an idiot.
section.sectiontitle2: Use like for general preferences and would like for something you want now or in the future.
section.text3: I like eggs. I have them for breakfast every day.
section.text3a: I would like a fried egg, please.
section.text4a: She would like to play with her friends now.
